I've reached the point where it's worthless to be angry about the #WhiteSox.

It's just sad. 39-42 at the halfway mark is not how it was supposed to be.

Worthwhile deal. Taking on a minor cap dump for a better dart throw.

#Blackhawks | #NHLDraft https://t.co/6RB48BvEYc

Overall, I'm pleased with the #Blackhawks' first-round selections.

Just surprised it wasn't the reverse â€” Nazar at 7, Korchinski at 13.

@Brokeeefe Detroit's all-in on the European prospects, and Yzerman's smarter than me, so who am I to judge?

That being said ... Savoie/Nazar would've been my pick in that spot.

The WHL is very kind to defensemen, especially two-way defensemen. The #Blackhawks got a guy who isn't afraid to play up on the rush, but don't look at a 65-point season and expect him to produce those numbers in the NHL.

Wouldn't have been my choice, but not totally against it.

Not going to lie. Kevin Korchinski was not among my Top 3 in that spot for the #Blackhawks.

Matthew Savoie, my top guy, might be there at 13 anyway, though. Would've gone Frank Nazar at No. 7.

Kirby Dach was SEVENTH on my board when the Hawks took him at No. 3 overall in 2019.

He was never it. Nabbing a Top 15 pick for him now is a win.

#Blackhawks | #NHLDraft

@AaronT61 I tend to not judge trades in isolation when there's a full rebuild on the horizon. There are too many avenues to bigger deals that exist right now.

If they come out of this draft with the DeBrincat swap being their only significant move ... at that point it becomes problematic.

(A) I'm not nearly as outraged over this price tag as most of the Hawks base seems to be.

(B) I'd love for the #Blackhawks to snag Matthew Savoie at No. 7 tonight. https://t.co/NsA51uSomw

The stockpile of talent already in the majors or upper levels of MiLB for the Orioles is remarkable.

The AL East is a monster of a division, but Baltimore is going to be a problem very, very soon. Already seeing so this season (MLB's best team on the run line).

This is my hometown.
